instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> it was liquid damage the board still works the trackpad has to be replaced too much corrosion on it. The issue is that even the keyboard not working and i measured all values and voltages all are going through the KB connector. I tried 2 new keyboard just to make sure. I was thinking maybe if it doesn't detect the trackpad the keyboard might not work? Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage
threads.message:
Keyboard information goes to PCH through trackpad circuitry.
So try first known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damage
threads.message: Thank you very much i'll try :)
